_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal (located in Danville, IL) is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. Nutrien Ag Solutions believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, the Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All Nutrien Ag Solutions employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.



The Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the community in which it operates. Nutrien Ag Solutions promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal is an existing Agricultural Service Provider. The facility is primarily involved in the receiving, storage, and distribution of fertilizers. The facility receives dry and liquid fertilizer via rail and truck, stores it onsite, and distributes it via truck.  The facility also includes a chemical retail business as well as a Butane Rail Offloading System with Vessel Storage and Truck Loading. The Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses the butane rail offloading station, butane storage ves

sel, valves, pump, compressors, loading station, and associated piping and ancillary equipment. Butane is offloaded from railcars at one offloading station, stored in one pressure vessel and transferred to tanker trucks through the use of a fixed piping system, vapor compressor, and loading pump.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS



Nutrien Ag Solutions' accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by the facility's regulated substance to employees/contractors, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR 1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal:



1) Employee Participation,

2) Process Safety Information,

3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA),

4) Standard Operating Procedures,

5) Operator Training,

6) Contractors,

7) Pre-startup Safety Review,

8) Mechanical Integrity,

9) Hazardous Work Authorization (Hot Work, etc.),

10) Management of Change,

11) Incident Investigation,

12) Emergency Procedures/Planning,

13) Compliance Audits, and

14) Trade Secrets.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidents within the past five (5) years as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.42 associated with the covered process.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Nutrien Ag Solutions Danville Terminal Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, and personnel medical emergencies.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Nutrien Ag Solutions is continually striving to make the Danville, IL Facility the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors and community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Nutrien Ag Solutions is to demonstrate continuous improvement in its health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, Nutrien Ag Solutions will work cooperatively with neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Danville, IL Facility, surrounding community, and the environment.
